languages.text: "Позвольте, шерин? Что-что, а читать людей жизнь меня научила". {n}Взгляд Джай скользит по фигурам мужчин.{/n} "Вот этот, молоденький и лоснящийся, не за вечер отъел гроксов жирок. А какой тембр — заслушаешься! Наверняка к "его святейшеству" выстраивается очередь за личной исповедью. Такому незачем знать священные тексты назубок". {n}Ухмылка Джай заставляет юношу покраснеть до ушей.{/n} "Ну а старик — один в один футфольский доходяга, дорвавшийся до сытного пайка — ряса висит на нем, как на жерди. Зато ставлю бутыль каликсийского, он искренен в своей вере. Другого таким и не остается!"

traits.locale_text: [draft] "Позвольте, шерин? Что-что а читать людей жизнь научила... Вот этот, молоденький и лоснящийся, не за вечер отъел гроксов жирок. А какой тембр — заслушаешься! Я бы захаживала к его святейшеству за личной исповедью". {n}Полуулыбка Джай заставляет юношу покраснеть до ушей.{/n} "А старик — один в один любой футфольский доходяга, дорвавшийся до еды. Разве что в рясе — да и та висит на нем, как на жерди. Держу пари, он проколется на первом же вопросе о вере".
traits.speaker: JaeCompanion

languages.text: "May I, shereen? If there is one thing life has taught me, it's how to read people." {n}Jae looks the two men over.{/n} "This one, his face so fresh and glossy, is like a nice, fat grox — you can't gain all that weight overnight. And his voice — a true delight! I'll wager people must stand in line for a chance to confess to 'his holiness' in private. Who cares how many holy texts he knows by heart?" {n}Jae's smirk causes the young priest to blush profusely.{/n} "As for the old man — he's acting exactly like a half-dead Footfall vagrant who has just stumbled upon a proper meal. His robes might as well be hanging from a long stick. But I will bet a bottle of Calixian wine that he is earnest in his faith — if only because folks like him have no other choice!"
languages.original_text: "Позвольте, шерин? Что-что, а читать людей жизнь меня научила". {n}Взгляд Джай скользит по фигурам мужчин.{/n} "Вот этот, молоденький и лоснящийся, не за вечер отъел гроксов жирок. А какой тембр — заслушаешься! Наверняка к "его святейшеству" выстраивается очередь за личной исповедью. Такому незачем знать священные тексты назубок". {n}Ухмылка Джай заставляет юношу покраснеть до ушей.{/n} "Ну а старик — один в один футфольский доходяга, дорвавшийся до сытного пайка — ряса висит на нем, как на жерди. Зато ставлю бутыль каликсийского, он искренен в своей вере. Другого таким и не остается!"

His robes might as well be hanging on a long stick. But I will bet a bottle of Calixian wine that he is earnest in his faith — because folks like him have no other choice!"

languages.text: "Darf ich, Shereen? Wenn das Leben mich eines gelehrt hat, dann, Menschen zu lesen." {n}Jae mustert die beiden Männer.{/n} "Dieser hier, mit frischem, glänzendem Gesicht, ist ein netter, fetter Grox – so viel Gewicht erhält man nicht über Nacht. Und seine Stimme – das reinste Vergnügen. Ich wette, die Leute stehen Schlange für eine private Beichte bei 'seiner Heiligkeit'. Wen interessiert schon, wie viele heilige Schriften er auswendig kann?" {n}Jaes Grinsen lässt den jungen Priester tief erröten.{/n} "Und was den alten Mann angeht – er verhält sich wie ein halbtoter Footfall-Vagabund, der gerade über eine anständige Mahlzeit gestolpert ist. Seine Robe könnte genauso gut an einer langen Stange hängen. Aber ich wette eine Flasche calixischen Wein, dass er in seinem Glauben aufrecht ist – wenn auch nur, weil Leute wie er keine andere Wahl haben!"
languages.original_text: "May I, shereen? If there is one thing life has taught me, it's how to read people." {n}Jae looks the two men over.{/n} "This one, his face so fresh and glossy, is like a nice, fat grox — you can't gain all that weight overnight. And his voice — a true delight! I'll wager people must stand in line for a chance to confess to 'his holiness' in private. Who cares how many holy texts he knows by heart?" {n}Jae's smirk causes the young priest to blush profusely.{/n} "As for the old man — he's acting exactly like a half-dead Footfall vagrant who has just stumbled upon a proper meal. His robes might as well be hanging from a long stick. But I will bet a bottle of Calixian wine that he is earnest in his faith — if only because folks like him have no other choice!"

Wen interessiert schon, wie viele heilige Schriften er auswendig kann?" {n}Jaes Grinsen lässt den jungen Priester tief erröten.{/n} "Und was den alten Mann angeht – er verhält sich wie ein halbtoter Footfall-Vagabund, der gerade über eine anständige Mahlzeit gestolpert ist. Seine Robe könnte genauso gut an einer langen Stange hängen. Aber ich wette eine Flasche calixischen Wein, dass er in seinem Glauben aufrecht ist – wenn auch nur, weil Leute wie er keine andere Wahl haben!"

languages.text: « Puis-je vous aider, shereen ? S'il y a bien quelque chose que je sais faire à merveille, c'est de lire les gens, {n}déclare Jae en observant les deux hommes.{/n} Celui-ci, avec son visage frais et son teint brillant, est comme un grox bien gras : on n'atteint pas ce poids en une nuit. Quant à sa voix... elle est envoûtante ! Je parie que les gens sont prêts à faire la queue pour se confesser à "sa sainteté" en privé. Qui se soucie vraiment du nombre de textes sacrés qu'il peut réciter par cœur ? {n}Le jeune prêtre rougit face au rictus provocateur de Jae.{/n} Quant au vieil homme... il se comporte comme un va-nu-pieds de Castel à moitié affamé qui vient de se voir offrir un repas copieux. Sous sa robe, il est maigre comme un clou. Je suis prête à parier une bouteille de vin de Calixis que sa foi est sincère, mais seulement parce qu'on ne lui a pas laissé le choix ! »
languages.original_text: "May I, shereen? If there is one thing life has taught me, it's how to read people." {n}Jae looks the two men over.{/n} "This one, his face so fresh and glossy, is like a nice, fat grox — you can't gain all that weight overnight. And his voice — a true delight! I'll wager people must stand in line for a chance to confess to 'his holiness' in private. Who cares how many holy texts he knows by heart?" {n}Jae's smirk causes the young priest to blush profusely.{/n} "As for the old man — he's acting exactly like a half-dead Footfall vagrant who has just stumbled upon a proper meal. His robes might as well be hanging from a long stick. But I will bet a bottle of Calixian wine that he is earnest in his faith — if only because folks like him have no other choice!"

traits.locale_text: « Puis-je vous aider, shereen ? S'il y a bien quelque chose que je sais faire à merveille, c'est de lire les gens, {n}déclare Jae en observant les deux hommes.{/n} Celui-ci, avec son visage frais et son teint brillant, est comme un grox bien gras : on n'atteint pas ce poids en une nuit. Quant à sa voix... elle est envoûtante ! Je parie que les gens sont prêts à faire la queue pour se confesser à "sa sainteté" en privé. Qui se soucie vraiment du nombre de textes sacrés qu'il peut réciter par cœur ? {n}Le jeune prêtre rougit face au rictus provocateur de Jae.{/n} Quant au vieil homme... il se comporte comme un va-nu-pieds de Castel à moitié affamé qui vient de se voir offrir un repas copieux. Sous sa robe, il est maigre comme un clou. Je suis prête à parier une bouteille de vin de Calixis que sa foi est sincère, mais seulement parce qu'on ne lui a pas laissé le choix ! »

languages.text: “可以让我说几句吗，亲爱的？如果说生活让我教会了我什么的话，那就是要如何看人。”{n}婕伊把两个人都打量了一番。{/n}“看看这个人吧，脸嫩得都能捏出水来，就像一头漂亮的格洛克斯兽一样！这可不是一两天就能保养出来的。还有他的声音，简直是太悦耳了！我敢打赌，人们肯定得排着长队，才能有机会私下里向这位‘牧师大人’忏悔。至于他脑子里装了多少经文，又有谁在乎呢？”{n}婕伊得意地笑了起来，年轻的牧师羞得面红耳赤。{/n}“至于这个老人，他现在的样子，就像落脚港半死不活的流浪汉突然吃了顿饱饭一样。这身长袍太不合适了，就像是挂在竹竿上一样。不过我敢拿卡利西斯最好的葡萄酒打赌，他对待信仰的态度绝对是认真的。毕竟像他这样的人，也没别的路可走了！”
languages.original_text: "May I, shereen? If there is one thing life has taught me, it's how to read people." {n}Jae looks the two men over.{/n} "This one, his face so fresh and glossy, is like a nice, fat grox — you can't gain all that weight overnight. And his voice — a true delight! I'll wager people must stand in line for a chance to confess to 'his holiness' in private. Who cares how many holy texts he knows by heart?" {n}Jae's smirk causes the young priest to blush profusely.{/n} "As for the old man — he's acting exactly like a half-dead Footfall vagrant who has just stumbled upon a proper meal. His robes might as well be hanging from a long stick. But I will bet a bottle of Calixian wine that he is earnest in his faith — if only because folks like him have no other choice!"

languages.text: «¿Me permite, shereen? Si la vida me ha enseñado algo, es a interpretar a la gente». {n}Jae mira a los dos hombres de arriba abajo.{/n} «En cuanto a este, tiene una cara fresca y brillante, como la de un grox gordo y bien cuidado, y no se gana todo ese peso en una noche. Y su voz: ¡una delicia! Apuesto a que la gente hace cola por la oportunidad de confesarse ante "su santidad" en privado. ¿Qué importa cuántos textos sagrados se conozca de memoria?». {n}La sonrisa de Jae hace que el joven sacerdote se sonroje.{/n} «En lo que respecta al anciano, actúa exactamente igual que un vagabundo de Paso medio muerto que acaba de encontrarse una comida de verdad. La túnica le quedaría igual de colgante a un palo largo. Pero apuesto una botella de vino calixiano a que su fe es sincera, ¡aunque solo sea porque la gente como él no tiene otra salida!».
languages.original_text: "May I, shereen? If there is one thing life has taught me, it's how to read people." {n}Jae looks the two men over.{/n} "This one, his face so fresh and glossy, is like a nice, fat grox — you can't gain all that weight overnight. And his voice — a true delight! I'll wager people must stand in line for a chance to confess to 'his holiness' in private. Who cares how many holy texts he knows by heart?" {n}Jae's smirk causes the young priest to blush profusely.{/n} "As for the old man — he's acting exactly like a half-dead Footfall vagrant who has just stumbled upon a proper meal. His robes might as well be hanging from a long stick. But I will bet a bottle of Calixian wine that he is earnest in his faith — if only because folks like him have no other choice!"

traits.locale_text: «¿Me permite, shereen? Si la vida me ha enseñado algo, es a interpretar a la gente». {n}Jae mira a los dos hombres de arriba abajo.{/n} «En cuanto a este, tiene una cara fresca y brillante, como la de un grox gordo y bien cuidado, y no se gana todo ese peso en una noche. Y su voz: ¡una delicia! Apuesto a que la gente hace cola por la oportunidad de confesarse ante "su santidad" en privado. ¿Qué importa cuántos textos sagrados se conozca de memoria?». {n}La sonrisa de Jae hace que el joven sacerdote se sonroje.{/n} «En lo que respecta al anciano, actúa exactamente igual que un vagabundo de Paso medio muerto que acaba de encontrarse una comida de verdad. La túnica le quedaría igual de colgante a un palo largo. Pero apuesto una botella de vino calixiano a que su fe es sincera, ¡aunque solo sea porque la gente como él no tiene otra salida!».

languages.text: 「いい？シェリーン。人生で唯一アタシが学んだものがあるとすれば、それは人の見抜き方よ」{n}ジェイは二人の男をじっと見ながら言った。{/n}「こいつはね、新しくてつやつやの顔をしてるけど、まるで太った蜥蜴牛みたいな奴よ。一晩でこんなに体重は増やせない。声もなかなかのものよ！人々はきっと、『聖なるお方』に個人的に懺悔する機会を得るために列を作って並んでいるに違いないわ。聖典をどれだけ暗記しているかなんて、どうでもいいのよ」{n}ジェイのにやりとした顔に若い司祭は顔を真っ赤にした。{/n}「それにしても年寄りの方は、まるで半死半生のフットフォールの浮浪者がやっとまともな食事を見つけたかのような振る舞いよね。ローブが長い棒にかかっているみたい。でもカリシャン・ワイン一本を賭けてもいいけど、彼は信仰に真剣だと思うわ。少なくとも彼みたいな人には他に選択肢がないからね！」
languages.original_text: "May I, shereen? If there is one thing life has taught me, it's how to read people." {n}Jae looks the two men over.{/n} "This one, his face so fresh and glossy, is like a nice, fat grox — you can't gain all that weight overnight. And his voice — a true delight! I'll wager people must stand in line for a chance to confess to 'his holiness' in private. Who cares how many holy texts he knows by heart?" {n}Jae's smirk causes the young priest to blush profusely.{/n} "As for the old man — he's acting exactly like a half-dead Footfall vagrant who has just stumbled upon a proper meal. His robes might as well be hanging from a long stick. But I will bet a bottle of Calixian wine that he is earnest in his faith — if only because folks like him have no other choice!"

traits.locale_text: 「いい？シェリーン。人生で唯一アタシが学んだものがあるとすれば、それは人の見抜き方よ」{n}ジェイは二人の男をじっと見ながら言った。{/n}「こいつはね、新しくてつやつやの顔をしてるけど、まるで太った蜥蜴牛みたいな奴よ。一晩でこんなに体重は増やせない。声もなかなかのものよ！人々はきっと、『聖なるお方』に個人的に懺悔する機会を得るために列を作って並んでいるに違いないわ。聖典をどれだけ暗記しているかなんて、どうでもいいのよ」{n}ジェイのにやりとした顔に若い司祭は顔を真っ赤にした。{/n}「それにしても年寄りの方は、まるで半死半生のフットフォールの浮浪者がやっとまともな食事を見つけたかのような振る舞いよね。ローブが長い棒にかかっているみたい。でもカリシャン・ワイン一本を賭けてもいいけど、彼は信仰に真剣だと思うわ。少なくとも彼みたいな人には他に選択肢がないからね！」

languages.text: "İzin verir misin şirinim? Hayat bana bir şey öğrettiyse o da insanları okumaktır." {n}Jae, iki adama birden göz gezdiriyor.{/n} "Şu taze ve parlak yüzlü olan; güzel, şişman bir groks gibi. O kadar kiloyu bir gecede alamazsın. Sesi de kulaklara şenlik! Bahse girerim insanlar, muhtereme özel olarak günah çıkarmak için sıraya giriyordur. Kaç kutsal metni ezbere bildiği önemsiz." {n}Jae'ın alaycı gülümsemesi, genç rahibin kıpkırmızı kesilmesine neden oluyor.{/n} "İhtiyara gelirsek... Sanki az önce doğru dürüst bir yemek bulmuş yarı ölü bir Binliman serserisi gibi davranıyor. Cübbesi uzun bir sopadan sarkıyor olabilirdi. Fakat bir şişe Calixis şarabına bahse girerim ki inancında samimi. Sırf onun gibilerin başka seçeneği olmadığı için!"
languages.original_text: "May I, shereen? If there is one thing life has taught me, it's how to read people." {n}Jae looks the two men over.{/n} "This one, his face so fresh and glossy, is like a nice, fat grox — you can't gain all that weight overnight. And his voice — a true delight! I'll wager people must stand in line for a chance to confess to 'his holiness' in private. Who cares how many holy texts he knows by heart?" {n}Jae's smirk causes the young priest to blush profusely.{/n} "As for the old man — he's acting exactly like a half-dead Footfall vagrant who has just stumbled upon a proper meal. His robes might as well be hanging from a long stick. But I will bet a bottle of Calixian wine that he is earnest in his faith — if only because folks like him have no other choice!"

traits.locale_text: "İzin verir misin Şirinim? Hayat bana bir şey öğrettiyse, o da insanları okumaktır." {n}Jae iki adama göz gezdiriyor.{/n} "Şu taze ve parlak yüzlü olan, güzel, şişman bir groks gibi. O kadar kiloyu bir gecede alamazsın. Ve sesi kulaklara şenlik! Bahse girerim insanlar 'muhterem'e özel olarak günah çıkarmak için sıraya giriyordur. Kaç kutsal metni ezbere bildiği kimin umurunda?" {n}Jae'ın alaycı gülümsemesi genç rahibin kıpkırmızı kesilmesine neden oluyor.{/n} "Yaşlı adama gelirsek... Sanki az önce doğru dürüst bir yemek bulmuş yarı ölü bir Binliman serserisi gibi davranıyor. Cübbesi uzun bir sopadan sarkıyor olabilirdi. Fakat bir şişe Calixis şarabına bahse girerim ki inancında samimi. Sırf onun gibilerin başka seçeneği olmadığı için!"
